info.main: Welcome to the world of networks. This first step will take you to great things in the future...
info.name: Introduction to Networking
info.results: Congratulations! Now the world will be a little safer thanks to you...

questions.q: What is a computer network and how has it evolved?

options.option: A set of connected devices for sharing resources and communicating.
A type of antivirus software that protects against specific malware.
A method for encrypting information sent over the network.
A device that controls network traffic between two or more networks.

questions.q: What are communication protocols and how do they work in networks?

options.option: A type of software that protects against Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks.
A method for segmenting the network into different security zones.
A set of rules that defines how devices communicate on the network.
A device that connects two different networks with different technologies.

questions.q: What is a network topology and what are the main topologies?

options.option: A type of software that manages and configures network devices.
A method for encrypting information sent over the network.
The way devices are organized and connected in a network.
A device that stores and manages files on a network.

questions.q: What are servers and what functions do they perform in a business computer network?

options.option: A type of software that protects against phishing attacks.
A device that connects two networks with different transmission speeds.
Devices that offer services, resources, and data to other devices on the network.
A method for segmenting the network into different security zones.

questions.q: What are some common types of servers and their functions?

options.option: Email server, web server, file server, application server.
Security server, proxy server, VPN server, DNS server.
Game server, chat server, print server, storage server.
All of the above.

questions.q: What are network reference models and why are they important?

options.option: A set of tools for network management.
Theoretical frameworks for understanding network communication and organization.
A type of software for network security.
Physical devices that enable internet connection.

questions.q: What are the main layers of the OSI Model and their functions?

options.option: Physical layer, application layer, transport layer.
Network layer, data link layer, presentation layer.
All of the above.
Options 1 and 2 are correct.

questions.q: How does the TCP/IP Model differ from the OSI Model?

options.option: The TCP/IP Model has fewer layers than the OSI Model.
The TCP/IP Model focuses on the architecture of the Internet.
The OSI Model is more commonly used in practice than the TCP/IP Model.
There are no significant differences between both models.

questions.q: What function does the transport layer serve in the TCP/IP Model?

options.option: Routing data across different networks.
Controlling the transmission of data reliably and in order.
Presenting data to the user application.
Transmitting data across the physical network.

questions.q: What examples of protocols are found in the application layer of the TCP/IP Model?

options.option: HTTP, FTP, SMTP.
TCP, IP, UDP.
Ethernet, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth.
ARP, DNS, DHCP.
